Kevin Lawrence wrote:

> As to JB's observation about whether it's possible to generate such
> tests for non-trivial programs - it's still early days for JUnit
> Factory but I think you'd be surprised by what's already possible.

I don't mean to imply that JUnitFactory's characterization tests aren't 
important. They are crucial to help understand how software works, 
although I wonder how many learning opportunities I would lose by having 
most of those tests discovered for me over discovering them myself. 
Writing characterization tests, themselves a specific kind of learning 
test, is partly about the test and partly about the learning by writing it.

I think JUnitFactory is a wonderful idea, and I'd love to see it in use 
on any Java project. (I was going to write "legacy Java project", but is 
there any other kind?)

Take care.
-- 
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
